solution_line_template: If there are {total_students} students in the class, then {math_fraction}*{total_students} = <<{math_fraction}*{total_students}={students_like_maths}>>{students_like_maths} students like maths.
The number of students who don't like math is {total_students}-{students_like_maths} = <<{total_students}-{students_like_maths}={students_not_math}>>{students_not_math} students.

If {science_fraction} of the students that don't like math like science, then {science_fraction}*{students_not_math} = <<{science_fraction}*{students_not_math}={students_like_science}>>{students_like_science} students like science.
The remaining number of students who enjoy history is {students_not_math}-{students_like_science} =<<{students_not_math}-{students_like_science}={students_like_history}>>{students_like_history}
The combined total for the students who want history and maths is {students_like_history}+{students_like_maths} = <<{students_like_history}+{students_like_maths}={combined_total}>>{combined_total}
